text:
I understand, we are one size fits all developers here too. AFAIK we don't have a single enterprise account so I don't have any experience with the sandbox thing.

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com//account/set-up-a-HubSpot-sandbox-account> does not mention content/pages/blogs at all though.

Hi everyone, I am embedding YouTube video’s in my blog posts, however, if I use the ‘embed’ function, it does not seem to work. If I paste the embed code directly through ‘Source code’, it still doesn’t work. Anyone knows what I am doing wrong. (The large white spaces are where the YouTube video should be shown)
<https://www.destintravel.nl/reisinspiratie/componist-camille-saint-saens?hsCacheBuster=5075>
<https://help.zoho.com/portal/en/community/topic/early-access-zoho-sign-extension-for-HubSpot?action=communityTopicLike&actionId=4011125191759>

Poking around in the console, it looks like the iFrame generated doesn’t have an src, but a data-src. This may be happening for lazy-loading purposes, but obviously the JS is not swapping these attributes when the user scrolls to them.
Thank you for checking! I noticed the same. It doesn’t change if I update the lazyload settings.
Is this a HubSpot bug or am I doing something wrong
Is there a ‘src’ attribute when you look in ‘view source?’
It could be either, but my gut tells me HS bug. The data-src is correct and the lack of a body within the iframe tells me it’s not a youtube problem
HubSpot adds the HTML and the data-src if I add any iframe, so seems some HubSpot functionality that is bugging
<@UD53A9UUR>
:eyes:
works in the preview
i was also able to embed it in a dummy post here <https://www.dennisedson.com/chatty-cathy/d>
i blame teun
So, something is wrong on my side ( or site)
i think it is specifically you
have your kid hit save and i bet it will be fine :wink:
Hahaha
Will do so

I have a question about using a HubSpot extension that requires you to create a HubSpot App. The extension is the Event Tickets HubSpot extension. I want to make sure I post the question in the right spot. Can someone point me? Don
I was looking on the page <@U26BLKGE4> - think I figured it out though.
needed to drill into the properties of the deal object
a little counter intuitive

Hi there, we are experiencing a security issue with a non-HubSpot form.
The Woocommerce registration form is sometimes (really randomly) sending the password (not even hashed) along with other regular data to our HubSpot.
Anyone can help on this?

My first guess would be the HubSpot WordPress plugin, which automatically listens for any form fills on your WP site and sends that info back to the CRM. I’d check the documentation for the plugin and see if there’s a way to have those forms with PW fields ignored.
*Redirect URLs*
We use redirect URLs for a specific lead source. We want to know how many times the lead source has been used. HubSpot doesn’t publish `count` for redirect URL usage.
To track, could we attach `utm` to the target URL without breaking anything? tia
Hi all, any idea on how to implement infinite scroll on blog listing page? any tutorials ?
